title: Is there even a point to giving feedback on the Veigar and Morde changes?
body: That wasn't actually a question. We all know the answer is no and that they'll go in anyway. Feedback didn't work for the jungle changes. It didn't work for the Cass rework. It didn't work for the Skarner rework. It didn't work for stopping mobility creep. And so on it goes.

replies.body:
How it will go:

**1**. Both reworks will go through (maybe a few buffs but not much).

**1.5**. Riot will ignore all complaints even if they are bucked up by math, saying that they know better

**2**. The reworks launch and everyone hates them because they feel like massive nerfs

**3**. Riot gives around 20 PR statements saying why these reworks are actually good

**3.5**. No one believes this "bullsh--" and Riot is forced to sacrifice even more resources because they didn't listen to the complaints from step **1.5**

**4**. Instead of fixing the rework they just buff them untill they are OP or near that level

**4.5**. The problems in the rework make it so that the champion has to be OP otherwise you lose all reason to play them ({{champion:69}} situation)

**5.** Riot ignores all future complaints saying that they fixed all the problems even though they never did.
If this is what it takes to make Mordekaiser OP, I'll accept it.

Or... it could go like the Ahri changes... Everyone complains so much that it fills the forums. People use all manner of math to show how little damage she does, then she's the strongest champ in the game.

That happened, and that's why Riot doesn't listen to us. Justified.

Because the Math undervalued the utility that is Mobility, just like Riot did. Last I checked, Veigar isn't getting any mobility in his kit, and he's more susceptible to mobile champions than he was before.
He is getting range though, and the forums have traditionally been idiots about how much that would affect champions.
Nope , he still has the same range on his ult , and thats more than 1/3 of the dmg. So , his range as a burst mage , is still the same.

The range for the ult may not have changed, but the ult isn't the only thing in the kit. More Q range means significantly safer farming, more potential to lane against high-range mages, more ability to throw off Qs in a teamfight without getting zoned out of the fight, etc. More E range helps in situations where you have an ally with CC, even with the delay. People underestimate range changes all the time. These are not irrelevant.

Again, these are "on-paper pros". I tested Veigar on PBE and I have to say that I actually like the skill shot, but you have to get in some awkward positions to last-hit properly ranged minions, thus exposing you even more than when he had less range. And as long as he gets zero mana back for last-hitting with Q, he won't be able to use his Q in lane to do anything that isn't farming.

And his E range is meaningless. Trust me. And please don't talk about mana or cooldown changes, they are even more meaningless.

>Again, these are "on-paper pros".

Two things. First, again? Who's said that before? Second, I've played I've played it on the PBE too. The Q last-hitting feels fine to me, and I've gotten quite a few situations where I can poke someone while farming with it (which helps improve him over the live Veigar's problem with last-hitting vs poking). I don't really find myself getting into awkward positions to last-hit the ranged minions very often, and it's pretty much never more exposed than it is on live. I think it's just better, in pretty much any given situation. I never find myself wanting the old Q.

If you want an "on-paper" problem, then here's my suggestion. On-paper, the E change looks absolutely devastating. In practice, it's not nearly so damning as everyone claims. 

>And his E range is meaningless. Trust me. And please don't talk about mana or cooldown changes, they are even more meaningless.

E range is helpful. Even 50 range goes a long way towards mitigating the . I don't know why you're bringing up mana and cooldowns given that I didn't even mention them, but if you want to discuss them so much, then I think that the mana buffs are pretty minor but the cooldown buffs can potentially be quite helpful, especially given the increased damage the W will be doing from increased stacking. "Meaningless" isn't one of the words I'd use to describe them.

I like this rework. It may need some small buffs, but that can be done. I know people overestimate the E nerf and they underestimate everything he's getting. People always underestimate range changes. I stick to that assertion.
It is true that he isn't getting mobility. But he is getting a better Q stacking mechanic and the ability to hit multiple people with it. We'll see how it shakes out.

I agree with you. She became super OP after the changes. But the people who complained were complaining about numbers, not utility, and Riot decided to add in a form of utility that pushed her over the edge and removed her counterplay. That's on Riot's part, not the community's for not predicting what that utility would do. Many people have said it was too strong since it was instant on demand mobility.

It was argued that she would be unviable as an assassin since Riot decided they didn't want that route to exist for her at all anymore.  We didn't ask for a hyper-mobile kite mage, all we wanted was burst compensation for DFG's removal.  What they did was refuse to interact with the community at any point during the projected changes, and removed the charm amp as well. 

Following the pattern of recent balance shifts, we can expect no meaningful interaction, and the changes will go through regardless of any argument we can make.  I'm not even a Veig OR Morde player, but I feel for you guys like I felt for Cass players.  The brick wall between Riot and Community is getting higher and thicker with every update.

Skarner is not a bad example, indeed is great: people told them they were destroying him and they kept saying "No, Skarner will be better". It was a really big fail to the point they had to re-rework Skarner to make up for their previous rework: thus proving that all those people who complaining about the first rework were right. And it's worth mentioning that once Skarner was viable after the re-rework, they gutted him taking away literally half his damage.

On the other hand the main problem with Cassiopeia is that they completely changed her playstyle without asking anyone and without anyone asking for it. Just a whim from the balance team: They wanted to force a new playstyle on Cassio players and they did it because they don't really care about anyone. As always, they said "no counterplay" "hidden power" and "unhealthy" as the reasoning behind the rework, they said damage over time was unhealthy and needed to go away. Also they said that it didn't fit thematically... well, I can't see why poison don't fit with a snake but launching green projectiles do.

tl;dr: They don't give a fuck about feedback, they just want everything to be the way they wanna do it. If they want to build this game that way, perfect, but don't ask to the community then.

Think about it like a game of SoloQ. Say someone (Riot) is not doing well, do you think they're more willing to take advice from you if you say "How about you play safe, try to farm up, and we'll win this in the lategame" or "f u feeder, uninstall"

Point of the matter, you're more likely to get Riot to notice your feedback and respond if you are a good person about it.
